predictions.text: The U.S. House or Senate will hold a floor vote on a War Powers Resolution or an explicit Authorization for Use of Military Force (AUMF) resolution that specifically references Venezuela or the operation that captured Nicolás Maduro, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if Congress.gov shows a roll-call floor vote (House or Senate) on a War Powers/AUMF measure whose text/title explicitly references Venezuela or the Maduro-capture operation, on or before 2026-03-31 UTC.
monitoring_signals: War Powers/AUMF bills introduced mentioning Venezuela
White House letters to Congress under War Powers reporting
predictions.rationale: Public controversy over authority/oversight makes a War Powers/AUMF vote more likely than in routine operations, though passage is uncertain.

predictions.text: OFAC will issue a revised or new Venezuela-related General License (or equivalent written guidance) that materially changes authorization for U.S. persons’ oil/gas transactions with PDVSA or named Venezuela state entities, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if OFAC posts a new/revised Venezuela GL (or FAQ/guidance explicitly tied to a GL) that expands, narrows, suspends, or conditions oil/gas transaction authorization involving PDVSA or named Venezuela state entities, by 2026-04-30 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Treasury press releases on Venezuela policy
Reported changes in compliance guidance from major banks/traders
predictions.rationale: A regime-change shock typically triggers sanctions-licensing recalibration to manage oil flows, leverage, and legal risk.

predictions.text: A regional multilateral body (OAS, CELAC, or UNASUR successor framework) will publish a joint communique/resolution on Venezuela that is signed or supported by at least 10 Latin American/Caribbean sovereign governments and explicitly references the U.S. strike/capture of Maduro, by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if an official OAS/CELAC (or comparable regional) document is published listing at least 10 sovereign government signatories/supporters and explicitly mentions the U.S. operation (strike/capture/arrest of Maduro) by 2026-02-28 UTC.
monitoring_signals: OAS Permanent Council special session announcements
predictions.rationale: Neighboring states face domestic and sovereignty pressures to react collectively, but coordination and wording can delay or dilute statements.

predictions.text: Commercial flight restrictions or major carrier reroutings tied to Venezuelan airspace/safety disruptions will persist for at least 14 consecutive days (measured by continuous advisory status or sustained cancellations/reroutes by major carriers), by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if, for any 14-day consecutive period ending by 2026-02-15 UTC, (a) official aviation advisories/NOTAMs or (b) documented major-carrier schedules show sustained Venezuela-related cancellations/reroutes affecting Caribbean routes (reported by a major outlet or airline statement).
monitoring_signals: Carrier travel waivers and schedule change bulletins
Airport/airline operational updates in the Caribbean
Daily cancellation totals reported by major media
predictions.rationale: Military/security uncertainty often causes prolonged operational disruptions, but airlines can adapt routes quickly if risk stabilizes.

predictions.text: Venezuela’s seaborne crude and condensate exports will be at least 25% lower in any full calendar month in 2026 Q1 than the average of Nov–Dec 2025, as reported by at least one of Kpler, Vortexa, or TankerTrackers, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if Kpler/Vortexa/TankerTrackers (or Reuters citing them) reports that any full month in 2026 Q1 has Venezuela seaborne crude+condensate exports ≥25% below the Nov–Dec 2025 average, published by 2026-04-30 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Port closures, insurance rate spikes, or force majeure notices
predictions.rationale: Operational disruption and compliance uncertainty commonly reduce liftings quickly even if global oil prices do not spike.

predictions.text: The U.S. President will issue at least one additional public divestment/unwind order (via CFIUS-related authority) targeting a China-linked investment in a U.S. semiconductor or semiconductor-equipment company, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if the White House or Treasury publicly releases an order requiring divestment/unwinding of a China-linked investment specifically involving a U.S. semiconductor or semiconductor-equipment firm (named), by 2026-09-30 UTC.
monitoring_signals: White House statements on CFIUS actions
Reported CFIUS mitigation failures in semiconductors
New executive actions on sensitive tech supply chains
predictions.rationale: A high-profile unwind raises the base rate for follow-on actions, but qualifying cases may be limited and often confidential.

predictions.text: China’s DRAM maker CXMT will file publicly viewable IPO documents (prospectus/filing notice) for a listing (STAR Market, Shenzhen, Hong Kong, or comparable venue) that targets gross proceeds of at least $3.0 billion (USD-equivalent) or explicitly cites a $3.0B+ fundraising goal, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if CXMT (or its listing vehicle) files IPO documents accessible via exchange/regulator systems or reported by Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ that state targeted proceeds ≥$3.0B USD-equivalent, by 2026-12-31 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Chinese semiconductor fund allocations to CXMT
Capex announcements and capacity ramp disclosures
predictions.rationale: A stated large IPO ambition is plausible amid industrial policy support, but market windows and regulatory timing are key constraints.

predictions.text: A major outlet (Reuters, Bloomberg, FT, WSJ, or CNBC) will report that tech founders/executives (at least 5 individuals) collectively sold at least $7.5 billion of public-company stock in 2026 H1, based on Form 4 or equivalent disclosures, by 2026-07-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if a qualifying outlet publishes a data-backed article stating that at least 5 tech founders/executives’ aggregate 2026 H1 sales total ≥$7.5B (USD), citing SEC filings/data providers, by 2026-07-31 UTC.
monitoring_signals: Form 4 clusters for mega-cap tech insiders
Media trend pieces on insider selling
predictions.rationale: Heavy 2025 selling increases the chance of another headline-sized H1 tally, but it depends on equity performance and lockup/plan timing.

predictions.text: BLS will report that U.S. core goods CPI (commodities less food and energy, seasonally adjusted) is positive year-over-year (>0.0%) in at least one monthly CPI release, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if any BLS CPI release through 2026-09-30 UTC shows the 'Commodities less food and energy commodities' index with YoY percent change >0.0% (not seasonally adjusted YoY comparison as reported by BLS tables).
monitoring_signals: Import price indices and USD trade-weighted moves
predictions.rationale: Tariff absorption and FX have muted prices so far, but lags and inventory turnover can push core goods inflation positive in 2026.

predictions.text: CDC (or a CDC-supported U.S. guideline body) will publish updated U.S. gonorrhea treatment guidance that includes a newly approved oral antibiotic (e.g., gepotidacin or zoliflodacin) as a recommended regimen or listed alternative, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Passes if CDC posts updated treatment guidance (STI guidelines update, MMWR, or official CDC webpage update) explicitly naming a newly approved oral antibiotic as recommended/alternative gonorrhea therapy, by 2026-12-31 UTC.
monitoring_signals: FDA approval actions for new gonorrhea antibiotics
CDC MMWR notices and STI guideline update schedules
predictions.rationale: Promising trial results increase update likelihood, but FDA approval timing and CDC guideline cadence create meaningful schedule risk.
